title: Immersive Virtual Reality-Based Bauhaus Design History Education Program

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Building experiential learning environments using VR devices and digital tools, with enhanced collaboration and discussion among learners

learning_goals: Learners can accurately analyze spatial and visual characteristics of Bauhaus works in a VR environment with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can explain the Bauhaus design philosophy and its social context based on three or more case studies through immersive simulation.
Learners can propose two or more improvements to design history education methodologies based on VR interface interaction experiences.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
